intro: Cryptocarya bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored cryptocarya, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocados. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves, which are typically dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are often white or yellowish in color. Cryptocarya bicolor is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
